intro: Chamaecrista belladonna, commonly known as the pretty panicled trefoil, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has trifoliate leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
